Class Pig

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pig

  • public class Pig
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Pig is a pig latin translation class. The rules it goes by are below:
    • If the word begins with a vowel, "way" is added to the end
    • If the word begins with a consonant, all consonants before the first vowel are added to the end, and then "ay" is added to the end
    The class deals with the following special cases:
    • If the first letter of a word is capitalized, the first letter of the returned word will be capitalized
    • Consonant sounds like "ch" and "sc" are preserved
    • y is treated as a vowel if there are no other vowels
    • w is treated as a vowel if there are no vowels and no y
    This class currently only has the ability to translate single words.

      • engToPigMain

        public static java.lang.String engToPigMain(java.lang.String w)
        This method is the primary translation method. It first checks whether the word given begins with a vowel, and adds "way" if it is. Otherwise, it takes the first consonant sounds, and puts them at the back, and adds "ay" to the end. The method then returns the string with the appropriate capitalization. The method also takes the punctuation off the end during the translation and adds it onto the end at the return statement.
        pre: w != null
        post: returns w, translated into pig latin.

      • engToPig

        public static java.lang.String engToPig(java.lang.String w)
        This method uses the single word translator, engToPigMain, and makes it compatible with hyphonated words. It does this by going through the word, splitting it along the hyphons and translating each section individually. If there are no hyphons it returns the word translated normally.
        pre: w != null
        post: translated string returned.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
